sent_question: he enjoys walking in the woods alone?
not all of the students from the class have been successful?
he doesn't like eating at fancy restaurants?
not all of the shirts at the store are expensive?
sent_manipulation: Bob spends a lot of time with his family.
John has kept in touch with all of the students.

sent_context: John and Bob were talking about sailing yesterday.
A year ago, Bob and John were talking about the students in a class they taught.
John and Bob were talking about restaurants yesterday.
Last month, Bob and John were talking about the selection of shirts at a local store.
expt_aim: How people judge sentences and what they conclude from them.
sent_inference: I enjoy going sailing with my father.
Some of the students from the class have been successful.
I don't like eating out at upscale places.
Some of the shirts at the store are expensive.
